metadata.title: CVE-2018-21030 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Jupyter Notebook before 5.5.0 does not use a CSP header to treat servedfiles as belonging to a separate origin. Thus, for example, an XSS payloadcan be placed in an SVG document.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-21030` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

jupyter-notebook - 5.7.8-1
python3-notebook - 5.7.8-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: jupyter-notebook package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.7.8-1').
